xxl.core.util
Class XXLSystem

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.XXLSystem

public class XXLSystem
extends java.lang.Object

The XXLSystem class contains system related methods. For example there are static methods to determine the memory size of an object. It cannot be instantiated.

See Also:
HashSet, Set, Array, Field, Modifier

Nested Class Summary
protected static class XXLSystem.Wrapper
          This class is a Wrapper for objects with the intention to distinguish two objects if and only if they refer to the same object.

Field Detail

NULL

public static final java.io.PrintStream NULL
The "standard" null stream. This stream is already open and ready to accept output data. Typically this stream corresponds to suppress any display output. This stream fills the gap in System providing "only" standard print streams for standard out and errors but no "null sink".

See Also:
PrintStream.println()

REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE

public static final int REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE
The default size of a reference in memory.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

sizeOf

public static int sizeOf(java.lang.Object object,
                         int referenceSize,
                         java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> excludedClasses,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> excludedFields,
                         int excludedFieldModifiers)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
The size of an object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. If the given object is an array the sizes of the array's components are computed recursively and the resulting memory size is incremented by 4 bytes (needed to save the length information of an array). Otherwise the algorithm determines the attributes (fields) of the object's class and its super classes. If an attribute's type is primitive, the according size is added to the object's memory size. Otherwise the attribute is an objects and its memory size is calculated recursively and added to the object's memory size.

Overview:

size of primitive types
byte, boolean : 1 byte
short, char : 2 bytes
int, float : 4 bytes
long, double : 8 bytes


size of references depends on the platform
32-bit platform : 4 bytes
64-bit platform : 8 bytes


size of primitive arrays: 4 bytes + (array.length * size of primitive type)

size of object arrays : 4 bytes + Σ(size of components)

All traversed attributes are inserted in a set, which represents an exact image of the allocated memory concerning the given object.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
referenceSize - the memory size of a reference.
processedObjects - a set containing the traversed attributes (required for cycle detection).
excludedClasses - a set of classes which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFields - a set of fields which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFieldModifiers - a bitmap identifying the modifiers of the fields that should be excluded from memory measurement.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field of the given object cannot be accessed.

sizeOf

public static int sizeOf(java.lang.Object object,
                         int referenceSize,
                         java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> excludedClasses,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> excludedFields,
                         int... excludedFieldModifiers)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
The size of an object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. If the given object is an array the sizes of the array's components are computed recursively and the resulting memory size is incremented by 4 bytes (needed to save the length information of an array). Otherwise the algorithm determines the attributes (fields) of the object's class and its super classes. If an attribute's type is primitive, the according size is added to the object's memory size. Otherwise the attribute is an objects and its memory size is calculated recursively and added to the object's memory size.

Overview:

size of primitive types
byte, boolean : 1 byte
short, char : 2 bytes
int, float : 4 bytes
long, double : 8 bytes


size of references depends on the platform
32-bit platform : 4 bytes
64-bit platform : 8 bytes


size of primitive arrays: 4 bytes + (array.length * size of primitive type)

size of object arrays : 4 bytes + Σ(size of components)

All traversed attributes are inserted in a set, which represents an exact image of the allocated memory concerning the given object.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
referenceSize - the memory size of a reference.
processedObjects - a set containing the traversed attributes (required for cycle detection).
excludedClasses - a set of classes which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFields - a set of fields which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFieldModifiers - the modifiers of the fields that should be excluded from memory measurement.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field of the given object cannot be accessed.

memSizeOf

public static int memSizeOf(java.lang.Object object,
                            int referenceSize,
                            java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects,
                            java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> excludedClasses,
                            java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> excludedFields)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
The main memory size of the given object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. The size of references on different platforms (i.e. 32-bit and 64-bit platforms respectively) can be specified separately. For determining the main memory size of the given object only static attributes are excluded from the memory measurement.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
referenceSize - the memory size of a reference.
processedObjects - a set containing the traversed attributes (required for cycle detection).
excludedClasses - a set of classes which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFields - a set of fields which are excluded during memory measurement.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field of the given object cannot be accessed.

memSizeOf

                            int referenceSize,
                            java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
The main memory size of the given object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. The size of references on different platforms (i.e. 32-bit and 64-bit platforms respectively) can be specified separately. For determining the main memory size of the given object only static attributes are excluded from the memory measurement.

memSizeOf

public static int memSizeOf(java.lang.Object object)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
The main memory size of the given object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. The size is computed for a 32-bit platform, i.e. a reference allocates 8 bytes of main memory. For determining the main memory size of the given object only static attributes are excluded from the memory measurement.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field of the given object cannot be accessed.

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(java.lang.Object object,
                                java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> excludedClasses,
                                java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> excludedFields)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
This method computes the (secondary) memory size of the given object. To get the memory size of the specified object, a reference to this object is needed. If this reference is null, the trivial case, the returned object size is 0 bytes. Otherwise sizeOf(Object, int, Set, Set, Set, int) is called, which analyzes the class this object is an instance of, the super classes and especially the memory size allocated for each non-static and non-transient attribute of these classes is determined and saved in a set. For further information of saving the objects in the set see XXLSystem.Wrapper.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
processedObjects - a set containing the traversed attributes (required for cycle detection).
excludedClasses - a set of classes which are excluded during memory measurement.
excludedFields - a set of fields which are excluded during memory measurement.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if a field of the given object cannot be accessed.
See Also:
sizeOf(Object, int, Set, Set, Set, int)

getObjectSize

                                java.util.Set<? super XXLSystem.Wrapper> processedObjects)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException

cloneObject

public static java.lang.Object cloneObject(java.lang.Object o)
Clones an object whether or not the clone method is protected (via reflection). If a clone is not possible, then a RuntimeException is thrown.

Parameters:
o - to be cloned.
Returns:
the cloned Object.

getOutPath

public static java.lang.String getOutPath(java.lang.String[] subdirs)
Constructs a directory inside the outpath with the desired subdirectory. The partial names of the subdirectory have to be passed inside the subdirs array. The path does not have a file separator at the end.

Parameters:
subdirs - partial names of the path
Returns:
whole path (contains a file separator at the end).

getDataPath

public static java.lang.String getDataPath(java.lang.String[] subdirs)
Returns a data path inside xxl/data, which points to a certain subdirectory. The partial names of the subdirectory have to be passed inside the subdirs array. The path does not have a file separator at the end.

Parameters:
subdirs - string containing subpath
Returns:
whole path (contains a file separator at the end).

getJavaVersion

public static double getJavaVersion()
Returns the version of the Java RTE (only the major version number).

Returns:
returns the Java RTE major version number

getValueFromMD

public static <I> java.lang.Object getValueFromMD(I key,
                                                  java.lang.Object object)
Tries to get a value from the meta data of given object, specified by the key. If the object does not implement the CompositeMetaData interface or the key is not found, null is returned.

Type Parameters:
I - the type o the key.
Parameters:
key - the specified key
object - an object
Returns:
the value specified by the key.
See Also:
CompositeMetaData
